title: Who is a technical writer? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Tech Support

response.answer_text: A professional writer who creates various types of technical documentation, helping people understand how to use a product or a service. The examples of the documentation technical writers create include: online help, user guides, online training material, white papers, design specifications, project plans, business correspondence, etc. This documentation can be delivered to the end user both as a printed version or as an electronic version. In many organizations, the role of a Technical Writer is delegated to software developers, support engineers, quality assurance engineers. ~Source: ClickHelp Glossary - Technical Writer

I iz a tecnikal r4iter!!!! I’ve been doing this for the best part of 40 years now and I love it. I’m currently the lead for a team of writers doing mountains of compliance documentation for a large company. It’s surprisingly fascinating stuff and I enjoy my job terrifically! I’ve done most kinds of technical writing in my career (though I still haven’t gotten to do the bits of writing on the backs of cake mix boxes; ah, well….). It’s a good way to make a living and I’m happy about my chosen career path.
